Aggregate a Ranges object

ranges-summarise.Rd

Aggregate a Ranges object

# S3 method for Ranges
summarise(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

a Ranges object
...

Name-value pairs of summary functions.

Value

a S4Vectors::DataFrame()

See also

dplyr::summarise()

Examples

df <- data.frame(start = 1:10, width = 5,  seqnames = "seq1",
strand = sample(c("+", "-", "*"), 10, replace = TRUE), gc = runif(10))
rng <- as_granges(df)
rng %>% summarise(gc = mean(gc))
#> DataFrame with 1 row and 1 column
#>                  gc
#>           <numeric>
#> 1 0.367872588802129
rng %>% group_by(strand) %>% summarise(gc = mean(gc))
#> DataFrame with 3 rows and 2 columns
#>   strand                gc
#>    <Rle>         <numeric>
#> 1      + 0.180136174273988
#> 2      - 0.475098506361246
#> 3      * 0.381412416696548
